params.text:
Introduction

Germany is world known for its many benefits, including an excellent healthcare system. In fact, in the 2022 World Index of Healthcare Innovation, Germany ranked 4th in overall healthcare performance, reaffirming its reputation as a leader in providing high-quality medical services. It also offers comprehensive insurance services to citizens and foreign residents. (https://www.germany-visa.org/insurances-germany/health-insurance/ )

metadata.title: How does the German healthcare system work?

params.text:
Facts and Figures about German Health system

•    Public health insurance is the largest insurance system covering around 90% of the population. 
•    Private health insurance covers the remaining 10%. 
•    Germany’s statutory health insurance companies currently have 4 million insured members, TK being the largest insurance provider. 
•    In 2021, Germany’s healthcare expenditure reached a total of 474.1 billion euros. 
•    In Germany, there are over 100 public health insurance companies. 
•    BKK Firmus has the lowest additional contribution rate starting at 0.9%. 
 

Source: https://www.germany-visa.org/insurances-germany/health-insurance/

params.textField:
According to a Healthcare index from 2022, Germany ranks *4th* in overall healthcare performance.

The vast majority of the population in Germany have a *public* health insurance.

params.text:
Why is it mandatory to have health insurance?


By making health insurance mandatory, the government ensures that all residents have access to essential medical services, regardless of their income or health status. Mandatory contributions from insured individuals, employers, and the government help sustain the healthcare system and reduce the burden on public services. (https://www.germany-visa.org/insurances-germany/health-insurance/)

Do International Students Need Health Insurance in Germany? 


Yes, international students in Germany are required to have health insurance. Generally, health insurance is a mandatory requirement by law for all residents and citizens in Germany, including students, whether international or local. 
This requirement ensures that students have access to necessary healthcare services and medical treatment in the country. Students must either enroll in public health insurance or obtain equivalent private health insurance coverage that meets German health insurance standards.
